label: cor-pipeline-continuity-margin-stability
label_text: Corollary: Pipeline Continuity Under Margin-Based Status Stability
name: Pipeline Continuity Under Margin-Based Status Stability
statement: Assume the **Axiom of Margin-Based Status Stability**. Then for all inputs $(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathbf{v}_{r1}, \mathbf{v}_{d1})$ and $(\mathcal{S}_2, \mathbf{v}_{r2}, \mathbf{v}_{d2})$, the deterministic bound $F_{\text{pot,det}}$ in the Deterministic Continuity theorem satisfies: $F_{\text{pot,det}}(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2, \mathbf{v}_{r1}, \mathbf{v}_{r2}, \mathbf{v}_{d1}, \mathbf{v}_{d2}) \;\xrightarrow[(d_{\text{Disp},\mathcal{Y}}(\mathcal{S}_1,\mathcal{S}_2),\,\|\Delta\mathbf{v}_r\|,\,\|\Delta\mathbf{v}_d\|)\to 0]{}\;0$. Moreover, for $d_{\text{Disp},\mathcal{Y}}(\mathcal{S}_1,\mathcal{S}_2)^2\le r_{\mathrm{status}}$ we have $n_c=0$ and the unstable term vanishes exactly; the remaining terms are controlled by the deterministic continuity of the patched standardization operator and the Lipschitz continuity of the potential map $F$.
full_statement_text:
Assume the **Axiom of Margin-Based Status Stability** ([](#def-axiom-margin-stability)). Then for all inputs $(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathbf{v}_{r1}, \mathbf{v}_{d1})$ and $(\mathcal{S}_2, \mathbf{v}_{r2}, \mathbf{v}_{d2})$, the deterministic bound $F_{\text{pot,det}}$ in [](#thm-deterministic-potential-continuity) satisfies
$$

F_{\text{pot,det}}(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2, \mathbf{v}_{r1}, \mathbf{v}_{r2}, \mathbf{v}_{d1}, \mathbf{v}_{d2})
\;\xrightarrow[(d_{\text{Disp},\mathcal{Y}}(\mathcal{S}_1,\mathcal{S}_2),\,\|\Delta\mathbf{v}_r\|,\,\|\Delta\mathbf{v}_d\|)\to 0]{}\;0.

$$
Moreover, for $d_{\text{Disp},\mathcal{Y}}(\mathcal{S}_1,\mathcal{S}_2)^2\le r_{\mathrm{status}}$ we have $n_c=0$ and the unstable term vanishes exactly; the remaining terms are controlled by the deterministic continuity of the patched standardization operator and the Lipschitz continuity of the potential map $F$.
proof_sketch: This corollary follows directly from the theorem by invoking the Axiom of Margin-Based Status Stability, which guarantees that status changes are bounded when swarm displacement is small. Under this axiom, when displacement is within the margin radius, the number of status changes $n_c=0$, eliminating the unstable term. The remaining stable term vanishes continuously as the inputs converge.
relations_established: For d_Disp^2 <= r_status: unstable term vanishes (n_c = 0)
Under Axiom of Margin-Based Status Stability, deterministic bound F_pot,det -> 0 as inputs converge
